messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:04): hsivonen: dunno how much time if any you've had lately to think about migrating the v.nu sources to a git or mercurial hosting service, but I wanted to say I'd be willing to do the work to make it happen
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:05): that is, dealing with actually getting them migrated over, as well as updating the build script and whatever else would be needed
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:05): github seems like it might best place to consider moving to
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:07): for among other reasons the network effects of the fact that there are so many very active developers there
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (20:09): github supports svn, btw
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (20:10): (see http://github.com/blog/644-subversion-write-support for more)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:13): fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98: part of the motivation is to get away from svn, actually
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:13): at least on my part
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:14): I've never been a big subversion fan
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:14): I really that github makes it dead simple to fork repos

fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (20:14): github's svn support is actually git-backed. it lets people who aren't yet comfortable with git use something familiar while the other collaborators forge on ahead with git
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:14): ah, I see
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:14): well that's good then
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (20:15): e.g. svn checkout http://svn.github.com/sideshowbarker/jsblog.git
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (20:16): (use https for a read/write checkout)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:19): cool
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:20): there more I use github, the more I like it
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:20): it ain't perfect but it was clearly designed by people with clue
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:21): and in general it just seems to work the way a system like that ought to
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (20:21): yeah, those guys are rad
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:22): the ease of forking and the culture really encourage experimentation

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:23): I think getting the validator.nu sources available there might help a lot toward getting some code contributions for yet-to-be-implemented features and bugs too
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:23): it'd raise more awareness about it and hopeflly get some more good devs involved
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:29): http://www.xtranormal.com/watch/6995033/ is pretty good
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:29): the first couple of minutes at least
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (20:47): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: still working on your KO?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:49): well, I'm just working on a personal KO
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:50): I don't want to embarrass myself by bringing much attention to it yet
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:50): but so far I've messed around a bit with express, Connect, and the ext.js stuff
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:51): and it's all really quite nice
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:52): and of course the fork I made of brianleroux's wtfs stuff
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:53): gotta love that dude
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:53): his comments in the "templating" part of that About page for that site are great

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:55): Nothing is perfect. And sometimes shit is just plain wack. The ExpressJS framework is seriously awesome but it has a hardon for HAML which solves problems I do not have. I opted, out of lazyness, for EJS which is not beautiful; tho it is functional.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:55): that part
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:55): http://wtfjs.com/about
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (20:58): ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2: what'd you got cooked up for KO?
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (20:59): well, I'm judging, but I am working on a canvas game thuing
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (21:00): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: y'know, I could always track down the repo :P
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:02): I'm just at the rubbing-two-sticks-together-to-make-fire stage
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:02): but then again, that's pretty much the stage at which all the code I write remains
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:03): regardless of what language it's written in
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:03): a one-man coding WTF
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (21:20): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: deployed anything yet?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:22): nope
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (21:34): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: what was your team name?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:34): no team, man
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (21:35): do you wish to have a team?
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (21:35): that would make you officially part of KO
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:35): yeah, in general
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:36): I prefer always to have other people to do my work for me when I can
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (21:36): okay, shoot an email to <email/> asking if you could have a team created for yourself
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:37): somebody from japan showing up on the map finally
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:37): connection
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:37): walter-sobchak
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (21:39): I thought he didn't code on shabbas
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:40): they have done some impressive work so far -
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:40): http://walter-sobchak.no.de/
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:41): bold, minimalist approach
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (21:41): hmm.. does unsaing-daiva keep coming up on the map?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:51): ah, my Webkit nightly seems to have a turned itself into a torture-testing tool for the fan on the laptop
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:51): to see how long it can continuously run at full speed until it quits completely
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:56): hmm, or maybe it's just that tab I had up for the xtranormal movie I started making 3 hours ago and forgot about til now...
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:06): How did noscript get all the way to issue status?

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:11): It was "raised for Shelley Powers" whose "purpose in wanting to file change proposals isn't that I expected any of them to succeed", so presumably the point is just to waste time and/or to make a point
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:13): So there's no filtering at all on issues now, any bug that gets closed has a free promotion card?
